headline: Copper Plunges More than 5% as Tariffs Hammer Metals and Miners
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Copper plunged more than 5% to trade below $9,000 a ton, in the biggest drop since July 2022, as worries over the impact of a worsening trade war sparked a heavy selloff in industrial metals and mining equities.
